item.title: The Complete Theme Guide
item.description: In creating visualizations, one aims not only to create a visualization that can convey the message behind the data but also to create a visualization that is appealing to the viewer. The theme function in ggplot allows for one to do so, but whenever I look at the reference page I sometimes become over whelmed by the number of components. For that reason, this post will focus on detailing non-data components of ones plot.
